PROCYCLIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Drug action
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Treatment cessation
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Parkinsonism, Extrapyramidal symptoms (but not tardive dyskinesia),

By mouth

  • For adults
    2.5 mg 3 times a day, then increased in steps of 2.5–5 mg daily if required; increased if necessary up to 30 mg daily in 2–4 divided doses, to be increased at 2–3 day intervals. Maximum daily dose only to be used in exceptional circumstances; maximum 60 mg per day.
  • For adults elderly
    Lower end of range preferable.

Acute dystonia,

By intramuscular injection or by intravenous injection

  • For adults
    5–10 mg, occasionally, more than 10 mg, dose usually effective in 5–10 minutes but may need 30 minutes for relief.
  • For adults elderly
    Lower end of range preferable.

Drug action

Procyclidine exerts its antiparkinsonian action by reducing the effects of the relative central cholinergic excess that occurs as a result of dopamine deficiency.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Use only if potential benefit outweighs risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Use with caution.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution.

Contra indications

  • Gastro-intestinal obstruction
  • myasthenia gravis

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Angle-closure glaucoma, blurred vision, confusion, constipation, dizziness, dry mouth, euphoria, gingivitis, hallucinations, impaired memory, nausea, rash, tachycardia, vomiting,

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • Cardiovascular disease
  • elderly
  • hypertension
  • liable to abuse
  • prostatic hypertrophy
  • psychotic disorders
  • pyrexia
  • those susceptible to angle-closure glaucoma

Advice regarding ceasing treatment

Avoid abrupt withdrawal in patients taking long-term treatment.

Prepared medicinal forms of PROCYCLIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral solution, oral suspension,
Tablet
Oral solution
Solution for injection
